instructions: ["Stand up straight with a kettlebell in both hands in front of your pelvis.", "Raise the kettlebell bending your arms at the elbow until the kettlebell is level with your chest.", "Lower to the starting position and repeat."]

name: Kettlebell Concentration Curl
instructions: ["Sitting on a chair with your legs apart, rest your arm against your thigh and hold the kettlebell with your arm extended towards the floor.", "Bending your arm at the elbow, lift the kettlebell until your palm faces your shoulder.", "Lower to the starting position and repeat."]

name: Kettlebell Preacher Curl
instructions: ["Stand behind a bench, with your chest leaning over the edge of the bench.", "With one arm resting on the bench, hold the kettlebell, bending the arm at the elbow.", "Lower your arm using the bench as a guide, keeping your forearm straight.", "Return to the starting position and repeat."]

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Curl
instructions: ["Stand up straight with a kettlebell in one hand with your forearm facing out.", "Raise the kettlebell, bending your arm at the elbow and keeping your forearm vertical until your palm faces the shoulder.", "Lower to the starting position and repeat."]

name: Biceps Stretch Variation Five
instructions: ["Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart.", "Raise your arms out to your sides, bringing them up to shoulder level.", "Rotate your palms so they are facing the ceiling.", "Then, change direction and rotate the arms as much as you can."]

name: Biceps Stretch Variation Four
instructions: ["Stand an arms width away from the wall.", "Raise your arms out behind you, and place them on the wall with your fingers pointing up.", "Bend your knees whilst keeping your hands in the same position."]

name: Biceps Stretch Variation Three
instructions: ["Bend your arm at the elbow, raising your hand to your shoulder.", "Using your other hand, stretch the arm down to its full extent."]

name: Biceps Stretch Variation Two
instructions: ["Stand facing the wall, an arm's width away.", "Place your hand on the wall with your fingers pointing down.", "Lean slightly into the wall to feel the stretch in your bicep."]

name: Biceps Stretch Variation One
instructions: ["Stand one foot in front of the other with the wall to your right, an arms width away.", "Place your hand on the wall, fingers pointing away from you.", "Gently lean forward, keeping your hand stationary.", "Repeat with the other arm."]

name: Cable Twisting Curl
instructions: ["Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.", "Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support.", "Start with a neutral grip. Flex at the elbow. While flexing twist your palm. When you hit the top of the movement your palm should be facing upward."]

name: Cable Bayesian Curl
instructions: ["Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.", "Face away from the cable machine.", "Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support. Face your palm forward. Flex at the elbow and extend."]

name: Cable Reverse Curl
instructions: ["Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.", "Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support.", "Face your palm downwards. Flex at the elbow and extend."]

name: Cable Hammer Curl
instructions: ["Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.", "Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support.", "Use a neutral grip thumb facing up pinky-facing down). Flex at the elbow and extend."]

name: Band Bayesian Curl
instructions: ["Attach band to a low anchor point. Point your palms straight forward.", "Flex your elbow until you feel your biceps contract. Then fully extend elbows."]

name: Band Bayesian Hammer Curl
instructions: ["Attach band to a low anchor point. Use a neutral grip.", "Flex your elbow until you feel your biceps contract. Then fully extend elbows."]

name: Band Bayesian Reverse Curl
instructions: ["Attach band to a low anchor point. . Point your palms toward your thighs.", "Flex your elbow until you feel your biceps contract. Then fully extend elbows."]

name: Dumbbell Reverse Curl
instructions: ["Grab the dumbbells with a pronated (overhand) grip. You can do this exercise thumbless if it's more comfortable on your wrists.", "Flex at the elbows until your biceps touch your forearms. Try not to let your elbows flair outward."]

name: Barbell Reverse Curl
overview: Barbell Reverse Curl: A Comprehensive Guide Setup Select a barbell with the appropriate weight for your strength level Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grip the barbell with a shoulder-width overhand grip Keep your arms straight and the barbell hanging at arm's length in front of your t
instructions: ["Take a double overhand grip that's about shoulder width. Flex your elbows while keeping your elbows tucked in. Try not to let them flare out.", "Curl until your forearm presses into your bicep. Then fully extend your elbows at the bottom of each rep."]

name: Dumbbell Incline Hammer Curl
instructions: ["Hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip (thumbs facing the ceiling). Seated on an incline bench.", "Slowly lift the dumbbell up to chest height", "Return to starting position and repeat."]

name: Dumbbell Incline Reverse Curl
instructions: ["Lay on an incline bench.", "Grab the dumbbells with a pronated (overhand) grip. You can do this exercise thumbless if it's more comfortable on your wrists.", "Flex at the elbows until your biceps touch your forearms. Try not to let your elbows flair outward."]

name: Dumbbell Incline Zottman Curl
instructions: ["Lay on an incline bench with your palms facing forward.", "Flex at the elbows until your forearms touch your biceps.", "When you hit the top of the movement, rotate your palms and then lower the dumbbells slowly."]

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Preacher Curl
instructions: ["Start with a with a dumbbell in one hand and your elbow resting on the bench.", "From this starting position, curl the dumbbell up towards your shoulder, keeping your upper arm stationary on the bench."]

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Spider Curl
instructions: ["Lay on an incline or preacher curl bench.", "Let your arms hang freely off the edge of the bench.", "Fully flex your elbow and fully extend your elbow on each rep."]

name: Dumbbell Spider Curl
instructions: ["Start by placing your forearms on a flat bench and holding a dumbbell in each hand.", "From this starting position, curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body and your core engaged.", "Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, and repeat for the desired number of repetitions."]

name: Dumbbell Twisting Curl
instructions: ["Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.", "Bring the dumbbells to your sides, with your palms facing inward and your elbows bent.", "From this starting position, curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders while rotating your wrists so that your palms face your shoulders at the top of the movement."]

name: Plate Curl To Overhead Press
instructions: ["Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso, palms facing forward.", "Curl the plate up to the front of the shoulder while keeping the elbows close to the body.", "Rotate the palms to face forward and press the plate overhead, locking out the arms.", "Lower the plate back to the starting position, keeping control of it, and repeat for desired reps."]

name: Plate Curl To Overhead Press To Tricep Extension
keywords: ["Plate", "Plate Curl To Overhead Press To Tricep Extension"]
instructions: ["Curl the plate up to the front of the shoulder while keeping the elbows close to the body.", "Lower the plate back behind the head to the starting position of a tricep extension.", "Push the plate back up overhead, then lower it back to the starting position and repeat for desired reps.", "Rotate the palms to face forward and press the plate overhead, locking out the arms.", "Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso, palms facing forward."]

name: Plate Squat Hold Curl
instructions: ["Lower into a squat position, keeping the plate at chest height.", "Slowly curl the plate towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.", "Hold for a moment at the top of the curl before lowering the plate back to chest height.", "Repeat the curls as you hold the squat position."]

name: Band High Curl
instructions: ["Anchor a band to a high point.", "Start with your feet staggered and your elbows high.", "Flex your elbows while keeping your arms high. Curl the band to your forehead."]

name: Band High Hammer Curl
instructions: ["Start with the band anchored to something high with your feet staggered and a neutral grip.", "Keep your elbows high. Curl until your fists are at your forehead."]

name: Band High Reverse Curl
instructions: ["Start with a band attached to a high point, your feet staggered, and an overhand grip.", "Flex your elbows pulling your forearms to your biceps. Your fists should land by your forehead."]

name: Band Curl
instructions: ["Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, with the band under both feet.", "Grasp the handles of the band with both hands, keeping your arms straight and extended in front of you.", "Keep your back straight, abs engaged, and shoulders relaxed as you curl your hands towards your shoulders, bending at the elbows."]

name: Band Reverse Curl
instructions: ["Start by standing on the center of the band with both feet, shoulder-width apart.", "Hold the band with both hands, palms facing down, arms extended straight in front of you.", "Slowly curl your hands towards your shoulders, pulling the band tight, then lower your arms back to the starting position, keeping tension on the band throughout the exercise."]

name: TRX Curl
instructions: ["Hold the TRX straps with an underhand grip and lean back and away from the anchor point.", "Keep your elbows high as you flex your elbows. Pull your fists toward your forehead."]

name: TRX Reverse Curl
instructions: ["Stand facing the TRX straps and grasp the handles with both hands, palms facing away from your body.", "Walk back until the straps are taut, keeping your arms straight.", "Slowly curl your hands towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body."]

name: Barbell Landmine Row
instructions: ["Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.", "Grasp the end of the barbell with a neutral grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.", "Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.", "Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up."]

name: Chin Ups
overview: How To Perform The Chin UpSetupGrab the Chin Up bar with an underhand grip. Make sure the bars are set very deeply in your hand. Your palms should be making contact with the bar. Next, if you are using a bench or box to reach the Chin Up bars, step off of the step, and hold for a second, in a dead h
instructions: ["Grab the bar shoulder width apart with a supinated grip (palms facing you)", "Slowly return to starting position. Repeat.", "With your body hanging and arms fully extended, pull yourself up until your chin is past the bar."]

name: Band Kneeling Single Arm Pulldown
instructions: ["Place the band at about eye level. Fall into a kneeling position.", "The knee that is on the ground should be the same side as the working arm. Stick your chest out.", "And then pull your elbow straight back. Flex your lats and then extend into the starting position."]

name: Barbell Long Landmine Row
instructions: ["Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.", "Grasp the end of the barbell with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.", "Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.", "Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up."]

name: Barbell Meadows Row
instructions: ["*Named after the late John Meadows", "Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.", "Grasp the end of the barbell with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.", "Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing sideways with a staggered stance and your feet shoulder-width apart.", "Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up."]

name: Barbell Pronated Pendlay Row
instructions: ["Pull the bar to your sternum.", "Return the plates back to the floor and let the bar come to a full dead stop.", "Start hinged forward with a flat back and the plates resting on the floor. Make sure your elbows are fully extended.", "Then initiate the next rep."]

name: Barbell Pronated Row
instructions: ["Extend your elbows fully before initiating the next rep.", "Grab the barbell with an overhand grip. Hinge forward while keeping your back flat until your torso is about parallel with the ground.", "Let your arms hang freely.", "Pull the bar to your torso while tucking your elbows in slightly."]

name: Barbell Supinated Pendlay Row
instructions: ["Begin by standing in front of a barbell with your feet about hip-width apart and your palms facing towards your body.", "Bend at the hips and knees to grab the barbell with a pronated (overhand) grip, positioning the barbell about an inch away from your shins.", "Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, use your back muscles to lift the barbell straight up towards your chest.", "As the barbell reaches your chest, rotate your wrists so that your palms are facing towards your body (supinated grip), and then lower the barbell back to the starting position."]

name: Barbell Supinated Row
instructions: ["As the barbell reaches your chest, pause briefly, and then lower the barbell back to the starting position.", "Begin by standing in front of a barbell with your feet about hip-width apart.", "Bend at the hips and knees to grab the barbell with a supinated (underhand) grip, positioning the barbell about an inch away from your shins.", "Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, use your back muscles to lift the barbell straight up towards your chest."]

name: Dumbbell Alternating Pendlay Row
instructions: ["The dumbbells should be set on the ground. Hinge forward while keeping a flat back.", "Pull one elbow back toward the ceiling and then return the dumbbell to the ground softly.", "Then pull with the other arm."]

name: Dumbbell Kneeling Single Arm Row
instructions: ["Place one hand and one knee on a bench. Make sure you keep a flat back.", "Pull the dumbbell toward the ceiling.", "Make sure to avoid any jerking or rotating."]

name: Dumbbell Laying Incline Row
instructions: ["Lay on an incline bench that is between 30-45 degrees high.", "Let your arms hang freely. Pull your elbows straight back toward the ceiling."]

name: Dumbbell Pendlay Row
instructions: ["The dumbbells should be placed on the floor.", "Hinge forward with a flat back and grab the dumbbells.", "Pull both dumbbells back and your elbows toward the ceiling.", "Return the dumbbells back to the floor softly on each rep."]

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Row
instructions: ["Make sure to keep your elbow close to your body and your core engaged throughout the movement.", "Start by standing in front of a flat bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand.", "Place your other hand on the bench for support, and bend at the waist so that your chest is parallel to the ground.", "From this starting position, row the dumbbell up towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blade together as you do so."]

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Row Knee
instructions: ["Start by placing your elbow on one knee.", "Hold a dumbbell in your other hand, with your palm facing inwards towards your body.", "From this starting position, row the dumbbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and your core engaged."]

name: Plate Pinch Grip Row
instructions: ["Bend forward at your hips while maintaining a flat back.", "Lower the weight in a controlled manner and repeat.", "Make sure to keep your elbow close to your body and your core engaged throughout the movement.", "Pull the plate toward your upper abdomen."]

name: Lawnmower Row
instructions: ["Stand with feet staggered and one hand on a bench/box. Hold a dumbbell in the opposing hand.", "Hinge forward at the hips, keeping the back flat, and eyes facing forward. The weight should hang directly below the shoulders.", "Start with an overhand grip, as you pull rotate the dumbbell. When your upper arm reaches your side your palm should be facing forward."]

name: Dumbbell Knee Lawnmower Row
instructions: ["Stand with feet staggered and one hand on your knee. Hold a dumbbell in the opposing hand.", "Hinge forward at the hips, keeping the back flat, and eyes facing forward. The weight should hang directly below the shoulders.", "Start with an overhand grip, as you pull rotate the dumbbell. When your upper arm reaches your side your palm should be facing forward."]

name: Dumbbell Supinated Row
instructions: ["Grab both dumbbells and hinge forward at the hips. Make sure you keep a flat back.", "The closer your torso is to parallel with the ground the longer the range of motion will be at your shoulder. The better the results you'll get from the exercise.", "Let your arms hang freely, maintain an underhand grip, and then pull your elbow joint straight back toward the ceiling."]

name: TRX Rotating Row
instructions: ["Grab the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point until the strap is taut.", "Start with an overhand grip. Pull your elbows back and rotate your grip.", "By the time your elbows reach your side, your palms should be facing upwards."]

name: Corpe Pose
instructions: ["Lie down on your back with your legs straight and arms at your sides.", "Close your eyes and take deep breaths in through your nose and out through your mouth.", "Allow your body to completely relax and let go of any tension.", "Hold for several minutes and then slowly come back up to a seated position."]

name: Crow Pose
instructions: ["Begin in a squatting position with your feet together and your knees apart.", "Place your hands on the floor in front of you, shoulder-width apart. Keep your arms straight and engage your core.", "Slowly shift your weight forward and lift your feet off the ground, coming onto your tiptoes.", "Bend your elbows and lean your weight onto your hands, shifting your knees towards your upper arms.", "Gently lift one foot off the ground, and then the other, balancing on your hands. Hold the pose for a few breaths before releasing back to the ground."]

name: Downward Dog
instructions: ["Begin on your hands and knees with your hands shoulder-width apart and your knees hip-width apart.", "Spread your fingers wide and press down into your palms, making sure that your fingers are evenly spaced and facing forward.", "Tuck your toes under and lift your knees off the ground, straightening your legs as much as possible.", "Press your hips up and back, bringing your body into an inverted \"V\" shape.", "Keep your arms straight and your shoulder blades spread apart, and try to press your heels down towards the ground.", "Hold the pose for several breaths, then release and return to your starting position."]

name: Downward Dog With Fingers Facing Feet
instructions: ["Begin in the same starting position as the previous exercise, with your hands and knees on the ground.", "Spread your fingers wide and turn your hands so that your fingers are facing towards your feet.", "Tuck your toes under and lift your knees off the ground, straightening your legs as much as possible.", "Press your hips up and back, bringing your body into an inverted \"V\" shape.", "Keep your arms straight and your shoulder blades spread apart, and try to press your heels down towards the ground.", "Hold the pose for several breaths, then release and return to your starting position."]

name: Scorpion Twist Pose
instructions: ["Begin in a downward-facing dog pose.", "Slowly lift one leg up towards the ceiling, keeping your hips level and your toes pointed.", "Bend your lifted leg and try to touch your toes to the back of your head.", "Once you have a firm grip with your toes, slowly begin to twist your torso towards the lifted leg.", "Keep your hands and feet firmly planted on the ground as you hold the pose for a few breaths. Release the pose and repeat on the other side."]

name: Seated Arm Stretch
instructions: ["Sit cross-legged on the floor.", "Extend your arms straight out in front of you, palms facing forward.", "Cross your right arm over your left arm and interlace your fingers.", "Pull your hands away from your body and hold for a few breaths, then release and repeat with the opposite arm on top."]

name: Barbell Bench Press
overview: Detailed How-ToDo Your Work Early (The Setup)We're going to start from the feet and work our way up.Foot PlacementYou can either be flat footed or just have toes on the ground. Either way, push your toes to generate some tension in your quads. Generating tension through your whole body will help you
instructions: ["Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. With straight arms unrack the bar.", "Lower the bar to your mid chest", "Raise the bar until you've locked your elbows."]

name: Dumbbell Incline Bench Press
overview: How To Perform The Dumbbell Incline Bench PressSetupSet an incline bench at around 30° high. Any higher than 30°, and the tension will go to your anterior deltoid as opposed to your upper pecs. A low incline is all you need. Getting the dumbbells into position for an incline bench press can be chall
instructions: ["Lay on the bench and set your feet on the ground.", "Raise the bench to a 30 - 45 degree angle", "Raise the dumbbells with straight arms then slowly lower them to about shoulder width.", "Raise them again until your arms are locked and at the starting position again."]

name: Dumbbell Incline Chest Flys
instructions: ["Lay flat on the bench and place your feet on the ground.", "Begin the exercise with the dumbbells held together above your chest, elbows slightly bent.", "Simultaneously lower the weights to either side.", "Pause when the weights are parallel to the bench, then raise your arms to the starting position."]

name: Barbell Incline Bench Press
overview: Barbell Incline Bench Press: A Comprehensive Guide Setup Choose a suitable weight for the barbell and place it on the incline bench Lie down on the bench with your feet firmly planted on the floor Grip the barbell with your palms facing away from your body Lift the barbell off the rack and hold it a
instructions: ["Position the bench between 30 and 45 degrees.", "Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. With straight arms unrack the bar.", "Lower the bar to your mid chest", "Raise the bar (slowly and controlled) until you've locked your elbows."]

name: Kettlebell Chest Press
instructions: ["Laying on the floor with your knees bent and feet firmly on the floor, hold the kettlebell at your chest with both hands.", "Fully extend your arms, raising the kettlebell until your elbows are locked.", "Lower the kettlebell to the starting position and repeat."]

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Chest Fly
instructions: ["Lie on the floor with your knees bent and feet firmly on the floor, with your arms to the side of your body.", "Holding a kettlebell in one hand, keeping your arm fully extended with a slight bend in the elbow and your forearms facing upwards, lift the kettlebell above your chest.", "Lower the kettlebell to the starting position and repeat."]

name: Kettlebell Single Arm Press
instructions: ["Laying on the floor with your knees bent and feet firmly on the floor, leave one arm resting to the side of the body.", "Using the other arm, hold the kettlebell at arms length directly upwards of your shoulder.", "Lower your arm until your upper arm to elbow is resting on the floor.", "Return to starting position."]

name: Kettlebell Walkover Pushup
instructions: ["Starting in a press up position with feet wide and one hand resting on the kettlebell, complete a full press up, lowering your chest towards the ground while keeping your body straight and returning to the starting position.", "Swap hands on the kettlebell, placing the hand originally on the kettlebell underneath your shoulder, complete another press up.", "Repeat."]

name: Chest Stretch Variation Four
instructions: ["Raise your arms to shoulder height, fully extended in front of you.", "Slowly bring your arms behind your back still at shoulder height.", "Pause for a few seconds and then return to starting position."]

name: Chest Stretch Variation Three
instructions: ["Place your arms behind your back and clasp your hands together.", "Slowly extend your elbows until they are locked then lift them away from you.", "Pause in this position for a few seconds and then return them to starting position."]

name: Chest Stretch Variation Two
instructions: ["Lay on your side with one hand just in front of you.", "With a slight bend in your arm, rotate your arm around your body as slowly as possible.", "Return to the starting position and then repeat on the other side."]

name: Chest Stretch Variation One
instructions: ["Using a raised wall, place your arm at a 90 degree angle against it.", "With a staggered stance, lean into the wall extending your chest.", "Pause for a few seconds and then return to starting position and repeat on opposite side."]

name: Push Up
instructions: ["Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders.", "Flatten your back so your entire body is straight and slowly lower your body", "Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body", "Exhale as you push back to the starting position."]

name: Decline Push Up
instructions: ["Use a bench to elevate your feet.", "Put your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.", "Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the ground", "Raise your body until you almost lock your elbows."]

name: Cable Pec Fly
instructions: ["Use a handle attachment set all the way to the bottom of the machine.", "Bring both of the handles to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover.", "Walk a few steps forward. Then press the weight forward. From there, your shoulders should horizontally abduct and adduct while your elbows stay in a fixed position."]

name: Cable Chest Press
instructions: ["Use a handle attachment. The cables should be set to shoulder height.", "Bring both of the handles to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover.", "Walk a few steps forward. Then press the weight forward.", "From there, you should flex and extend at both the shoulders and elbows simultaneously."]

name: Band Single Arm Pec Fly
instructions: ["Attach the band to an anchor point that is about shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.", "Extend your shoulder joint and bring your arm across your body until you feel a contraction in your pecs."]

name: Band Single Arm Chest Press
instructions: ["Attach the band to an anchor point that is about shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.", "Extend your shoulder joint and elbow across your body until your arm is fully extended."]

name: Band Pushup
instructions: ["Loop the band around your mid-back. The ends of the bands should be around your hands between your thumb and pointer finger.", "This exercise can be done from the knees or the toes depending on experience level.", "Begin by breaking at the elbows until your upper arm is by your side. Then extend at the elbows back into the top position."]

name: Barbell Floor Press
overview: Barbell Floor Press: A Comprehensive Guide Setup Start by selecting a barbell that is appropriate for your strength level and place it on the floor. Lie down on the floor with your back flat and feet flat on the ground. Grasp the barbell with both hands, using a grip that is slightly wider than shou
instructions: ["Un-rack the bar and break at the elbows and shoulders.", "Bring your elbows to the floor, rest for a second to remove all the momentum from the rep, then press to a lockout."]

name: Barbell Hooklying Bench Press
instructions: ["Start in a bench press position with your feet planted on the bench and knees bent.", "Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, positioning your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.", "Lift the barbell off the rack and lower it to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.", "Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms."]

name: Barbell Larsen Bench Press
instructions: ["Bring the bar to your torso and tap your ribcage before pressing back to the ceiling.", "Start in a bench press position with your legs elevated. Try to keep your knees with a slight bend in them.", "Unrack the bar then initiate the rep."]

name: Barbell Spoto Press
instructions: ["Start on the bench with your shoulder blades pulled back.", "As you initiate the first rep, tuck your elbows slightly until the bar is a few inches off your chest.", "Pause just off your chest for 1-3 seconds. Then press explosively."]

name: Dumbbell Chest Fly
instructions: ["Lay on a bench with two dumbbells extended in front of you.", "You should have a slight bend in your elbows and maintain that bend. Your shoulder joint should do all the movement.", "Bring the dumbbells out to your side. Stop the dumbbells before going behind your body.", "Bring the dumbbells back together at the top."]

name: Dumbbell Decline Alternating Single Arm Press
instructions: ["Lay on a decline bench with both arms extended in front of you.", "Break at one of your arms first bringing that arm to your side while keeping the other arm extended.", "Press the dumbbell back to the ceiling. Fully extend that arm before initiating on the other side."]

name: Dumbbell Decline Chest Fly
instructions: ["Lay flat on a decline bench press with the dumbbells pointed toward the ceiling.", "Maintain a slight bend in your elbows. Bring the dumbbells out to the side, stopping the dumbbells before they pass your torso.", "Bring the dumbbells together to finish the rep."]

name: Dumbbell Decline Guillotine Bench Press
instructions: ["Lie on the decline bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing forward.", "Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows flared out. As you lower the dumbbells, exhale deeply.", "Once your elbows reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position"]

name: Dumbbell Decline Neutral Bench Press
instructions: ["Lie on the decline bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body.", "Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body.", "Once the dumbbells reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position.", "This variation is much easier on the shoulder joints."]

name: Dumbbell Decline Single Arm Bench Press
instructions: ["Start by laying on a decline bench with two dumbbells.", "Position the dumbbell above your chest with your elbow bent and shoulder level.", "Slowly lower the dumbbell towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and your core engaged while the other dumbbell remains pointed toward the ceiling.", "Once the dumbbell reaches your side, pause for a moment and then press the weight back up to the starting position.", "Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching to your other arm."]

name: Dumbbell Decline Squeeze Press
instructions: ["Break at the elbows and keep your elbows tucked as you bring the dumbbells to your chest.", "Continue to press the dumbbells into one another throughout the rep.", "Lay flat on a decline bench with two dumbbells pressed to one another.", "Once the dumbbells reach your chest, press back toward the ceiling."]

name: Dumbbell Guillotine Bench Press
instructions: ["Lie on the flat bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing forward.", "Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows flared out. As you lower the dumbbells, exhale deeply.", "Once your elbows reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position"]

name: Dumbbell Guillotine Incline Bench Press
instructions: ["Lie on the incline bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing forward.", "Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows flared out. As you lower the dumbbells, exhale deeply.", "Once your elbows reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position"]

name: Dumbbell Incline Chest Fly
instructions: ["Lay on an incline bench with two dumbbells extended in front of you.", "You should have a slight bend in your elbows and maintain that bend. Your shoulder joint should do all the movement.", "Bring the dumbbells out to your side. Stop the dumbbells before going behind your body.", "Bring the dumbbells back together at the top."]

name: Dumbbell Internally Rotated Chest Fly
instructions: ["Lay on a bench with two dumbbells extended in front of you in an overhand grip.", "You should have a slight bend in your elbows and maintain that bend. Your shoulder joint should do all the movement.", "Bring the dumbbells out to your side. Stop the dumbbells before going behind your body.", "Bring the dumbbells back together at the top."]

name: Dumbbell Internally Rotated Incline Chest Fly
instructions: ["Lay on an incline bench with two dumbbells extended in front of you.", "You should have a slight bend in your elbows and maintain that bend. Your shoulder joint should do all the movement. You should have an overhand grip.", "Bring the dumbbells out to your side. Stop the dumbbells before going behind your body.", "Bring the dumbbells back together at the top."]

name: Dumbbell Neutral Bench Press
instructions: ["Lie on a flat bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body.", "Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body.", "Once the dumbbells reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position.", "This variation is much easier on the shoulder joints."]

name: Dumbbell Neutral Incline Bench Press
instructions: ["Lie on an incline bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body.", "Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body.", "Once the dumbbells reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position.", "This variation is much easier on the shoulder joints."]

name: Dumbbell Squeeze Press
instructions: ["Lay flat on a bench with two dumbbells pressed to one another.", "Break at the elbows and keep your elbows tucked as you bring the dumbbells to your chest.", "Continue to press the dumbbells into one another throughout the rep.", "Once the dumbbells reach your chest, press back toward the ceiling."]

name: Dumbbell Single Arm Press
instructions: ["Start by laying on a bench with two dumbbells.", "Position the dumbbell above your chest with your elbow bent and shoulder level.", "Slowly lower the dumbbell towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and your core engaged while the other dumbbell remains pointed toward the ceiling.", "Once the dumbbell reaches your side, pause for a moment and then press the weight back up to the starting position.", "Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching to your other arm."]

name: Burpee
instructions: ["Jump your feet back towards your hands, and then jump up into the air, reaching your arms overhead.", "Land softly and immediately lower your body back into the squat position to repeat the movement.", "Perform a push-up, keeping your core tight and your elbows close to your body.", "Quickly jump your feet back into a plank position, keeping your body in a straight line from your head to your toes.", "Start standing with your feet hip-width apart. Lower your body into a squat position, placing your hands on the ground in front of you."]

name: Band Chest Fly
instructions: ["Secure two resistance bands to a sturdy anchor point (e.g. a door anchor, a post, etc.) at chest height.", "Stand facing away from the anchor point with feet shoulder-width apart and hold each end of the band in each hand.", "Start with arms fully extended and parallel to the floor.", "Keeping arms straight, slowly bring your arms together in front of your chest."]

name: Band Chest Press
instructions: ["Stand in the middle of the two bands with feet shoulder-width apart. Step forward with one foot to create tension in the bands.", "Hold one band in each hand, palms facing forward.\nStart the exercise with your arms extended in front of you, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.", "Lower your arms to the sides of your chest, maintaining control of the band.", "Push your arms back up to the starting position, keeping your core engaged and maintaining control of the band."]

name: Band Internally Rotated Chest Fly
instructions: ["Start with both feet hip-width apart and step on the middle of the band with both feet. Hold the handles of the band in each hand and position the band above your chest, with your palms facing down.", "Keeping your elbows slightly bent, slowly raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel with the floor. Make sure to internally rotate your shoulder joints by bringing your shoulder blades together and rotating your forearms inward towards your torso.", "Hold the position for a few seconds and then slowly lower your arms back to the starting position, keeping the internal rotation of your shoulder joints throughout the movement."]

name: Plate Deficit Pushup
instructions: ["Start in a pushup position with both hands on a plate. This will extend your range of motion.", "Break at the elbows and shoulders until your upper arm travels behind the body slightly.", "Then press back into the original position."]

name: Plate Glute Bridge to Chest Press
instructions: ["Lay flat on the ground with a plate on your chest.", "Push your hips up toward the ceiling and maintain that extended position.", "With your hips up, press the plate toward the ceiling."]

name: Dumbbell Elevated Pushup
instructions: ["Start by placing two dumbbells on the floor, about shoulder-width apart.", "Position yourself in a plank position with your hands on top of the dumbbells, keeping your arms straight.", "Keep your feet together, with your toes resting on the floor.", "Engage your core and lower your body towards the floor by bending your arms, until your chest nearly touches the dumbbells.", "Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms and engaging your chest, triceps and shoulders."]

name: Pushup to Renegade Row
instructions: ["Keep your core engaged and your back straight as you row one dumbbell up towards your hip, keeping your elbow close to your body.", "Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position and repeat on the other side.", "Start in a high plank position with a pair of dumbbells positioned under your shoulders. Your hands should grip the dumbbells, palms facing each other."]

name: TRX Pec Fly
instructions: ["Start by adjusting the TRX straps to chest height. Stand facing the TRX with your feet shoulder-width apart.", "Grasp the TRX handles with both hands, keeping your arms extended and your shoulders away from your ears.", "Lean forward, keeping your arms extended and your core engaged. Your body should form a slight diagonal line from your ankles to your head.", "Slowly bring your arms towards each other, in front of your chest, while keeping your core engaged and your body in a stable position."]

name: TRX Pushup
instructions: ["Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line.", "Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.", "Stand facing the TRX straps, grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders.", "Start by setting up the TRX straps to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them."]

name: Dumbbell Alternating Single Arm Press
instructions: ["Break at one of your elbows first while keeping the other elbow extended.", "Start in a bench press position with two dumbbells.", "Then alternate to the other arm.", "Your working arm should reach your side before pressing back to the ceiling."]

name: Bow Pose
instructions: ["Lie on your stomach with your arms at your sides.", "Bend your knees and bring your heels towards your buttocks.", "Reach back with your hands and grab your ankles.", "Inhale and lift your chest off the ground, pulling your legs up and back with your hands.", "Keep your gaze forward and hold the pose for a few breaths before releasing back to the ground."]

name: Yogi Arm Clock
instructions: ["Stand facing a wall with your arms extended and your palms pressing into the wall at shoulder height.", "Slowly begin to walk your feet away from the wall, keeping your arms straight and your hands pressing into the wall.", "Walk until your arms are fully extended and your body is at a 45-degree angle to the ground.", "Repeat From High to Low Angles starting above the shoulder, and ending below the chest."]

name: Mountain
instructions: ["Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.", "Press your feet into the ground and engage your leg muscles.", "Lift your chest and roll your shoulders back and down.", "Take a deep breath in, and as you exhale, release any tension in your body and relax your muscles."]

name: Tree Pose
instructions: ["Start in mountain pose, standing with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.", "Shift your weight onto your left foot and bend your right knee, bringing the sole of your right foot to the inside of your left thigh.", "Bring your hands together in front of your heart, or raise them overhead.", "Hold the pose for a few breaths, then release and repeat on the other side."]

name: Warrior One
instructions: ["Start in mountain pose, standing with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.", "Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and turn it slightly inward, while keeping your right foot facing forward.", "Inhale and raise your arms overhead, then exhale and bend your right knee, bringing it directly over your ankle.", "Hold the pose for a few breaths, then inhale and return to mountain pose. Repeat on the other side."]

name: Warrior Two
instructions: ["Start in mountain pose, standing with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.", "Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and turn it slightly inward, while keeping your right foot facing forward.", "Inhale and raise your arms to shoulder height, parallel to the ground, with your palms facing down.", "Exhale and bend your right knee, bringing it directly over your ankle while keeping your left leg straight.", "Look over your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths, then inhale and return to mountain pose. Repeat on the other side."]

name: Supported Matsyasana Pose
instructions: ["Sit on the floor with your legs stretched out in front of you.", "Place a yoga block behind you, horizontally, at the base of your spine.", "Slowly recline over the block, supporting yourself with your forearms, until your back is resting on the block.", "Relax your arms at your sides, palms facing up, and breathe deeply."]

name: Machine Leg Press
instructions: ["Place your legs on the platform with your feet at shoulder width.", "Release the weight and extend your legs fully, without locking your knees.", "Lower the weight until your legs are at a 90\u00b0 angle (but DO NOT allow your butt and lower back to rise off of the pad. This will put your lower back in a rounded position, which is very dangerous.)", "Raise the weight back to starting position."]

name: Machine Leg Extension
instructions: ["Sit on the machine with your back against the cushion and adjust the machine you are using so that your knees are at a 90 degree angle at the starting position.", "Raise the weight by extending your knees outward, then lower your leg to the starting position. Both movements should be done in a slow, controlled motion."]

name: Bulgarian Split Squat
instructions: ["Go back to the starting position. After completing the desired amount of reps, switch legs and repeat.", "Squat down until your front leg is about parallel to the floor.", "Stand with your back to a bench (or raised surface) and place one of your feet on the bench."]

name: Kettlebell Step Up
instructions: ["Standing up straight, using a bench as a step, raise one foot onto the bench and hold the kettlebell in the same arm as the straight leg.", "Stand and bring both feet onto the bench. Slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position.", "Repeat."]

name: Kettlebell Goblet Squat
instructions: ["Hold the weight tucked into your upper chest area, keeping your elbows in. name: Kettlebell Heels Up Goblet Squat

name: Kettlebell Reverse Lunge
instructions: ["Stand straight with your feet slightly apart and hold a kettlebell in one hand.", "Bring the same leg as the arm holding the kettlebell behind you, squat down until your back knee touches the ground, keeping your back straight.", "Return to the starting position and repeat."]

name: Kettlebell Lateral Lunge
instructions: ["Stand straight with your feet shoulder width apart. Keep your back straight and hold the kettlebell in front of your pelvis.", "Take a large step to one side, holding the kettlebell low and lunge into the bent leg.", "Return to the starting position and repeat"]

name: Quads Stretch Variation Four

name: Quads Stretch Variation Three
instructions: ["Lay flat on your belly, with both hands reach back and grab the tops of your feet.", "Keeping your upper legs flat on the ground, pull both of your feet towards your buttocks.", "Pause at the apex of the stretch, then return to starting position."]

name: Quads Stretch Variation Two
instructions: ["Place one foot flat on the ground in front of you at a 90 degree angle. With your other leg, balance upon your knee, placing the tip of your foot against the wall behind you for balance.", "Place your hands on your knee in front of you, and lean forward so that your knee extends over your foot.", "Pause at the apex of the stretch, and slowly return to starting position. Repeat with your other leg."]

name: Quads Stretch Variation One

With your other arm, grab the top of your foot.", "Pull your leg upwards and back to engage your quads, pausing at the apex of the stretch for a few seconds.", "Return to starting position and repeat with your other leg."]

name: Side Lunges

name: Jump Squats
instructions: ["Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.", "Start by doing a regular squat, then engage your core and jump up explosively.", "When you land, lower your body back into the squat position."]

name: Bodyweight Squat
instructions: ["Stand with your feet shoulder width apart.", "flex your knees and hips and sit back into the squat while lowering your body", "Continue down to full depth", "Return to starting position."]

name: Barbell Curtsy Lunge

name: Cable Goblet Squat

name: Cable Split Squat

name: Cable Standing Leg Extension
instructions: ["Stand upright facing away from the cable crossover with the cable set to the height of your hips. Use an ankle/wrist attachment.", "Extend at the knee against the cable."]

instructions: ["Find a box or bench that is roughly knee height or a few inches lower. instructions: ["Pull your shoulder blades back really hard and place the bar on your posterior delts.", "Push your hips back and break at the knees to initiate the squat.", "Aim to get your hamstrings to parallel with the ground. instructions: ["Aim to get your front leg to hit parallel depth (hamstring parallel with the ground) or lower.", "Find a box or bench that is roughly knee height or a few inches lower. The further back your front foot is, the longer the ROM at your knees.", "You can either place your toes or the top of your foot on the box. Point your front foot forward or slightly turned outwards and break at the knees and hips simultaneously."]

name: Barbell Coan Deadlift
instructions: ["As you lift the barbell, pull your shoulders back and squeeze your glutes to fully extend your hips at the top of the movement.", "Bend at the hips and knees to grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, positioning your hands just outside of your hips.", "Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, lift the barbell off the floor by extending your hips and knees.", "Stand with your feet hip-width apart and place a barbell on the floor in front of you."]

name: Barbell Forward Lunge
instructions: ["Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell at your shoulders with an overhand grip.", "Step forward with your right foot and bend both knees to lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground.", "Push off your right foot to return to the starting position."]

name: Barbell Front Rack Step Up
instructions: ["Stand in front of a step or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell at your shoulders with an overhand grip.", "Step up onto the bench with your right foot, pushing off your foot to raise your body up onto the bench.", "Bring your left foot up onto the bench and stand up straight, keeping the barbell at your shoulders.", "Step back down with your left foot, followed by your right foot, to return to the starting position."]

name: Barbell Heels Up Back Squat

name: Barbell Pause Box Squat

name: Barbell Pause Squat
instructions: ["Lower your body into a squat position, pausing for a moment at the bottom of the movement before standing back up.", "Push through your heels to return to the standing position.", "Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and a barbell resting on your upper back."]

name: Barbell Reverse Deadlift

name: Barbell Reverse Lunge

Your feet should be slightly pointed outward, and your shoulders should be down and relaxed.", "Step backward with one foot, lowering your body until your front thigh is parallel to the ground and your back knee is hovering just above the ground.", "Push off your back foot, returning to the starting position."]

name: Bodyweight Reverse Step Up
instructions: ["Start with a box or bench behind you and one of your feet on the box/bench.", "The balls of your feet should be planted on the box/bench.", "Drive through the ball of your foot extending your knees until you're upright and standing on the box."]

name: Barbell Side Step Up

name: Barbell Split Squat

Your front knee should be bent at a 90-degree angle, and your back leg should be straight.", "Push through the heel of your front foot to raise your body back to the starting position."]

name: Barbell Step Up Balance

name: Barbell Step Up

name: Barbell Tap Pause Squat
instructions: ["Begin by standing in front of a sturdy box or bench that is about knee-height, holding a barbell across your upper back and shoulders, using an overhand grip.", "Sit back and lower your body down until your glutes tap the top of the box, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.", "Push through your heels to extend your hips and stand up, bringing your body back to the starting position."]

name: Barbell Zercher Squat

name: Assisted Bulgarian Split Squat
instructions: ["Grab a stick of some sort or hold onto something stable (rack, bench).", "Grab a box that is knee height or slightly lower.", "Hold the stick in your right arm and put your right leg on the box.", "Begin your squat by breaking at the knees. Get your knee close to the floor or all the way to the floor. Make sure to keep your chest tall."]

name: Curtsy Lunge
instructions: ["Step your left foot diagonally behind your right leg, crossing it behind your body. name: Forward Lunge
instructions: ["Step forward with one leg and lower your body until your front thigh is parallel to the floor and your back knee almost touches the ground. Keep your chest up and your front foot flat on the floor.", "Push through your front foot to straighten your legs and return to the starting position.", "Repeat the movement with your other leg."]

name: Heels Up Squat
instructions: ["Place your heels on a plate or very low step.", "Keep your chest tall and initiate the squat by pushing your hips back and breaking at the knees.", "You should notice yourself able to squat lower than normal."]

name: Lateral Lunge
instructions: ["Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine. This will help to stabilize your body.", "Take a large step to the side with your right foot, planting it firmly on the ground.", "As you step, bend your right knee and lower your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. Your left leg should remain straight.", "Push through your right heel to return to the starting position. Repeat on the opposite side by stepping out with your left foot."]

name: Bodyweight Reverse Lunge

name: Split Squat
instructions: ["Take a split stance. Make sure to keep your chest tall.", "Bring your rear knee to the floor or close to it.", "Drive through your front heel and your rear foot back to the starting position."]

name: Dumbbell Forward Lunge
instructions: ["Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing each other.", "Take a big step forward with your right foot, lowering your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the ground and your left knee is hovering just above the floor.", "Push through your right heel to straighten your right leg and return to the starting position."]

name: Dumbbell Goblet Curtsy Lunge
instructions: ["Stand with your feet hip-width apart and a dumbbell in a goblet position.", "Step your left foot behind and to the right of your right foot, crossing it behind your right leg.", "Bend your knees and lower your hips down and back, as if you were about to sit in a chair.", "Push through your right heel to straighten your right leg and return to the starting position."]

name: Dumbbell Goblet Forward Lunge
instructions: ["Hold a dumbbell in a goblet position.", "Step forward with one of your legs while bending at your back leg. Bring your back knee to the floor or close to the floor.", "Push through your front leg explosively to get back to your starting position."]

name: Dumbbell Goblet Lateral Lunge
instructions: ["Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine. This will help to stabilize your body.
